name: Thunderbird BIU Compose Icons
description:
Replace the ugly Tango "triple-A" icons in Tb3 and later with the classic BIU icons from Tb2 -- for the Bold, Italic, and Underline buttons in the compose window formatting toolbar.

How to install this style in Thunderbird: click green Install button below, Switch to Edit, select all/copy code to a New Style window for Tb Stylish, and Save.

user.name: NotTheMama
user.about: You can call me "Earl" (but ya doesn't has ta call me "Johnson"). My profile at AMO Bug 1121291 is proof positive--Mozilla is full of complete idiots with not a shred of common sense.

additional_info:
I've tested the style in Tb3 and Tb9 without problems. I expect it works in later releases, but I don't know for sure. Once I get around to using later releases of Thunderbird, then I'll test it there. If anyone else tries it out in some releases later than Tb9, and it either works or doesn't, then let me know. Thanks.

(And, yes, Thunderbird 3 still works perfectly fine--if not better--compared to the later releases, which added bunches of useless features having nothing whatsoever to do with sending and receiving email. Plain text--or even Simple HTML--looks pretty much the same in every release of Thunderbird; and neither POP nor IMAP nor SMTP has changed much in many, many years.)
